action.action-desc: Mr. Hagerty (for himself and Mr. Gallego) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To modernize Federal firearms laws to account for advancements in technology and less-than-lethal weapons, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Innovate to De-Escalate Modernization Act.

section.header: Exemption of certain less-than-lethal projectile devices from restrictions under title 18, United States Code

subsection.text: Section 921(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in the second sentence of paragraph (3), by inserting or a less-than-lethal projectile device before the period; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The term less-than-lethal projectile device means a device that—

clause.text: is not designed or intended to expel, and may not be readily converted to accept and discharge—

subclause.text: ammunition commonly used in handguns, rifles, or shotguns; or
any other projectile at a velocity exceeding 500 feet per second;

clause.text: is designed and intended to be used in a manner that is not likely to cause death or serious bodily injury; and
does not accept, and is not able to be readily modified to accept, an ammunition feeding device—

subclause.text: loaded through the inside of a pistol grip; or

subparagraph.text: If a person requests that the Attorney General determine whether a device satisfies the definition of less-than-lethal projectile device under subparagraph (A), the Attorney General shall make the determination not later than 90 days after the date on which the Attorney General receives the device pursuant to the request.
